b6cb3272-8c41-4130-9b76-c52efdb766a1.description: The earner of this badge is a self-navigating professional learner. Through designing and leading action research projects in their own school context, they model a contemporary approach to professional learning. They trial new teaching approaches and strategies, using data to assess impact. They share their learning with like-minded educators and seek feedback from colleagues, helping to build a culture of collegiality across a network.
b6cb3272-8c41-4130-9b76-c52efdb766a1.name: ISV Teacher Inquiry Group participant 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in Teacher Inquiry Group (TIG) meetings to share innovations in practice. Be guided on how to run inquiry/action research processes in the classroom.

Develop and participate in an action research project supported through coaching and feedback from the TIG facilitator and fellow TIG team members. Create a process journal to document the project. Produce a showcase presentation and/or report to share results.

f024b809-7a3e-44b8-bdad-513776c6508b.description: The earner of this badge is a leader of professional learning able to support the inquiry of teachers across a network. They are able to effectively develop and maintain relationships, influencing others to take action to improve student learning. Through designing and leading action research projects in their own context and facilitating projects in other schools, they model a contemporary approach to professional learning and enable others to build capacity.
f024b809-7a3e-44b8-bdad-513776c6508b.name: ISV Teacher Fellows 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in Fellows’ training focusing on leadership, team development, inquiry and adult learning. Attend ‘master class’ events focusing on facilitation and inquiry and share at a showcase event. Design and lead Teacher Inquiry Group meetings.
Curate and post Teacher Inquiry Group support material on ISV's Canvas platform. Collect evidence of Teacher Inquiry Group meetings.
Document evidence of an action research project including meeting specified milestones. Showcase a presentation and/or report of the inquiry.
Complete a formal application to the Teacher Fellows program and interview for a limited number of positions. Obtain a Principal endorsement as part of the selection process.

0514cfcc-59ba-403e-8706-db83d9beea8b.description: The earner of this badge is a self-navigating professional learner. Through designing and leading action research projects in their own school context, they model a contemporary approach to professional learning. They trial new teaching approaches and strategies, using data to assess impact. They share their learning with like-minded educators and seek feedback from colleagues, helping to build a culture of collegiality across a network.
0514cfcc-59ba-403e-8706-db83d9beea8b.name: ISV Teacher Inquiry Group participant 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in Teacher Inquiry Group (TIG) meetings to share innovations in practice. Be guided on how to run inquiry/action research processes in the classroom.

Develop and participate in an action research project supported through coaching and feedback from the TIG facilitator and fellow TIG team members. Create a process journal to document the project. Produce a showcase presentation and/or report to share results.

ed6cab23-6bf7-4654-943f-8be2705ffac5.description: The earner of this badge is a leader of professional learning able to support the inquiry of teachers across a network. They are able to effectively develop and maintain relationships, influencing others to take action to improve student learning. Through designing and leading action research projects in their own context and facilitating projects in other schools, they model a contemporary approach to professional learning and enable others to build capacity.
ed6cab23-6bf7-4654-943f-8be2705ffac5.name: ISV Teacher Fellows 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in Fellows’ training focusing on leadership, team development, inquiry and adult learning. Attend ‘master class’ events focusing on facilitation and inquiry and share at a showcase event. Design and lead Teacher Inquiry Group meetings.
Curate and post Teacher Inquiry Group support material on ISV's Canvas platform. Collect evidence of Teacher Inquiry Group meetings.
Document evidence of an action research project, including meeting specified milestones. Showcase a presentation and/or report of the inquiry.
Complete a formal application to the Teacher Fellows program and interview for a limited number of positions. Obtain a Principal endorsement as part of the selection process.

60a39780-4cc4-41a8-ace9-16f8ebaec50f.description: The earner of this badge is a leader in education who focuses on the role of school leaders in creating adaptive capacity within the boundary of their own school system. They work collaboratively both within the educational sector and beyond to create a more robust ecology that serves the needs of students.
60a39780-4cc4-41a8-ace9-16f8ebaec50f.name: LILAed 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in professional learning in LILAed 2021/2022 - Change Pressures: Creating Adaptive Capacity in Schools, facilitated in conjunction with Project Zero from Harvard Graduate School of Education.

Participate and contribute to a four-day learning innovation lab that includes presentations and provocations by leading academics and engage in professional conversations utilising protocols and frameworks to assist learning with and from each other.
Connect deeply with researchers and other members of the LILAed community. Members represent Principals of schools from Asia Pacific (APAC).
Take on experimental initiatives based on ideas shared by academics and identified through Insights, Puzzles and Actions throughout the learning lab.

7a76554d-672b-4ba4-9664-b49a937c916a.description: The earner of this badge has made an active contribution to the Principal Executive Network. They recognise the value of compliance, employment relations essentials, financial management and school operations. They have established connections with Victorian Independent School Principals. They are a seeker of new knowledge and skills and are open to innovation and to learn from diverse school and educational practices.
7a76554d-672b-4ba4-9664-b49a937c916a.name: Principal Executive Network Member 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in four webinars designed for Principals new to their role or transitioning form another school or state Topics ranged from Teacher review and Performance Management, Managing School Finances, VRQA, school compliance, Principal Wellbeing to Tracey Ezard.
Build strong networks with Principal colleagues from Independent Schools.
Participate in optional online coaching sessions with an accredited coach to develop and implement professional goals.

Attend at scheduled residentials which entail interactive sessions with expert speakers and an opportunity to network and learn with other school principals on a range of topics from Governance to Teaching Learning and Change Management.
Prepare a 3-minute talk on purpose, including coaching to present a story to inspire educators. Present to colleagues and use in various contexts with their own school community.
Explore emotional and psychological wellbeing career transition support through the external Mindful Leading Program.

0c000e18-d6fb-46a9-a68c-0ed25d875ca0.description: The earner of this badge is a leader in education who understands the uniquely human traits that will help students thrive in an increasingly automated world. They are a seeker of new knowledge and skills and connect these to their own practice. They contribute to a learning community that values the skills of communication, collaboration and conversation. LILAed is a collaborative learning lab for new ways of thinking and doing in education.
0c000e18-d6fb-46a9-a68c-0ed25d875ca0.name: LILAed 2020/2021

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in professional learning in LILAed 2020/2021 - Shaping Learning Ecologies for an AI-Human Synergistic world, run in conjunction with Project Zero from Harvard Graduate School of Education.
Contribute to a four-day event, focusing on professional conversation and learning about Artificial Intelligence.
Connect deeply with researchers and other members of the LILAed community. Members represent Principals of schools from Asia Pacific (APAC).
Take on experimental initiatives based on ideas shared by academics.

38fbaefc-ba43-4ddb-b876-8bda5fd667d3.description: The earner of this badge uses innovationXdesign principles to seek solutions for challenges. They have the mindset, skillset and toolset required to develop innovative strategies to make the most of opportunities, change and challenges.
38fbaefc-ba43-4ddb-b876-8bda5fd667d3.name: innnovationxdesign

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in professional learning in innovationXdesign developing skillsets, mindsets and toolsets required in the process. This process involves in course collaboration and in school collaboration in between modules external to the course time. The participant finishes the course with a prototype and innovationXdesign tools ready to implement in their school.
Design and use innovationXdesign toolkit to design a prototype and implement in a school.

c0f7f3a9-41d1-430a-8631-286d59220778.description: The earner of this badge understands key principles from the Science of Human Learning. Not only can they describe these principles, but they have demonstrated the ability to apply these principles to their practice and utilise evidence to iterate and drive future practice. The earner of this badge has the ability to define and generate evidence of impact within their unique context.
c0f7f3a9-41d1-430a-8631-286d59220778.name: ISV Cognizance Project: Science of Human Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Participating in the Cognizance teacher course virtual lessons or listening to the recordings which are available in isLearn
Submitting two micro-projects

3a614fb8-9a32-4ba0-97ce-c028881fb8c3.description: The earner of this badge has made an active contribution to the Principal Executive Network. They recognise the value of compliance, employment relations essentials, financial management and school operations. They have established connections with Victorian Independent School Principals. They are a seeker of new knowledge and skills and are open to innovation and to learn from diverse school and educational practices.
3a614fb8-9a32-4ba0-97ce-c028881fb8c3.name: Principal Executive Network Member 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Build strong networks with Principal colleagues from Independent Schools.

Actively participate in five sessions designed for Principals new to their role or transitioning from another school or state. Topics ranged from Teacher Review and Performance Management, Managing School Finances, VRQA, School Compliance, and Principal Wellbeing
Participate in optional online coaching sessions with an accredited coach to develop and implement professional goals.

Attend scheduled residentials which entail interactive sessions with expert speakers and an opportunity to network and learn with other school principals on a range of topics from Governance to Teaching Learning and Change Management.
Explore emotional and psychological wellbeing career transition support through the external Mindful Leading Program.

3f9b9381-c7ef-433e-90d0-85776cf1984a.description: The earner of this badge has advanced their leadership development and mindset as a principal with tactical insight for best-in-class approaches to lead. They have gained the know how to improve their school and develop themselves into a more effective leader through leading edge approaches to managing human capital within complex organisations. They have built a strong network of alumni with whom to continue developing themselves as leaders.
3f9b9381-c7ef-433e-90d0-85776cf1984a.name: Principals' Leadership Academy 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in and complete Principals’ Leadership Academy
Complete assignments in relation to each session
Complete course work such as case study readings
Actively participate in and contribute to the learning in sessions
Build strong networks with Alumni to continue developing self as leaders

3a615724-aa9b-4f0a-9c31-a7a8cd196d0a.description: The earner of this badge is a collaborative learner who adapts with flexibility and authenticity of practice through the voices of the child in the ECEC setting. They have shown a willingness and courage to become a co-facilitator of learning with the children, and able to demonstrate a reflective practice, in alignment to the EYLF and VEYLDF learning outcomes. They have shown a collegiate spirit in sharing educational practices and in presenting a portfolio of work.
3a615724-aa9b-4f0a-9c31-a7a8cd196d0a.name: Pilot Program with Monash University - PLayLab

badge_template_activities.title: Prepare, annotate, and present key learnings and observations of change to practice and level of engagement by the children within their educational setting.
Create a project, based upon the Conceptual PlayLab STEAM pillars and outcomes. Ensuring authenticity of practice and contextual relevance to the ECEC setting, whilst being age appropriate.
Demonstrate any shift in practice and show the pedagogical knowledge and understanding to align STEM and VEYLDF / EYLF

724943e5-8864-4fb7-8420-b97d99af2330.description: The earner of this badge is engaged in conversation about the future of learning, schools, and education. They are able to effectively develop and maintain relationships with peers and educators, influencing others to take action and make positive changes. Through the design thinking process and coaching, they are able share thoughts, ideas and questions, and create provocations to enable others to build capacity.
724943e5-8864-4fb7-8420-b97d99af2330.name: Reignite Student Panel Member 2022-2023

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in Student Fellows’ training focusing on voice and agency. Attend workshops focusing on provocation, and share at Reignite launch event.

e63f082a-4c9e-4009-9128-e1a4c1c27230.description: The earner of the ‘Transforming your team's culture: The 4 Stages of Psychological Safety™’ badge understands The 4 Stages of Psychological Safety™ - inclusion safety, learner safety, contributor safety, and challenger safety. This leads to the creation of deeply inclusive environments, embracing diversity, accelerating learning, increasing contribution, and stimulating innovation. The participant has completed a 30-day action plan to embed the key principles.
e63f082a-4c9e-4009-9128-e1a4c1c27230.name: Transforming your team's culture

alignments.name: Create and maintain supportive and safe learning environments
alignments.description: Demonstrate and lead by example the development of productive and inclusive learning environments across the school by reviewing inclusive strategies and exploring new approaches to engage and support all students.

alignments.name: Engage in professional learning
alignments.description: Plan for professional learning by accessing and critiquing relevant research, engage in high-quality targeted opportunities to improve practice and offering quality placements for pre-service teachers where applicable.

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in professional learning and complete the LeaderFactor The 4 Stages of Psychological Safety™ assessed online course.
Completion, application, and reflection of the 30 days of psychological safety practice influencing participation in teams and collaborative environments.

0f55d049-23cc-4860-a9e4-78c903535e2d.description: The earner of this badge is a self-navigating professional learner who adapts to and embraces the changing demands of their profession. They generate questions and actively seek knowledge and skills to support their aspirations to positively impact student outcomes. They engage in action research to add to the collaborative expertise within their school community. They gather and act on feedback and model their learning process for students and colleagues to support a positive learning culture.
0f55d049-23cc-4860-a9e4-78c903535e2d.name: Action & Impact Level 2: Verbal de-escalation: crisis management

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in professional learning in 'Verbal de-escalation: crisis management'
Create and execute an action research project based on the professional learning
Complete a report template documenting the rationale, process, outcomes and next steps.

skills.name: Understanding Of Strategies To De-escalate Challenging Behaviour

b906cd68-7a6c-4593-9cc8-3ee0c9824231.description: The earner of this badge understands the key emotional, psychological, social, and contemplative factors that support purpose-finding and well-being, the basis of a flourishing life. They know how to apply tools and skills to increase one’s sense of lived purpose, manage stress effectively and enhance overall wellbeing in times of complex change. They reflect on how to construct meaning and purpose in one’s work and life.
b906cd68-7a6c-4593-9cc8-3ee0c9824231.name: Project Wayfinder: Making Meaning

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in an innovative learning program from ISV in partnership with Project Wayfinder and the Stanford Flourishing Project. The program supports (re)discovering a sense of purpose and belonging, at school and beyond. A blend of webinars and self-paced material provides a greater understanding of the key factors that support purpose and wellbeing and how to apply these to effectively to enhance wellbeing in times of complex change.
Planning and undertaking purpose compass project.
